page.title: 09 Country living.
page.content: Not many years ago it was the poor who lived in the small{villages}in tiny {cottages}clustered around the green, the{church}and the big house. Since the early nineteen-sixties and the growth of individual prosperity, it is the better-off who can afford the luxury of living in the country, dependent on the{car}to travel to work and with the money to alter and extend the{cottages}and provide them with the many conveniences of modern life. There is less distinction between poor and wealthy and{villages}such as those in the block surveyed now contain few of the original inhabitants. Where generations grew up, married, lived and died in the same{village,}there is now much greater movement around the country and from house to house. The local{councils}provide some housing for those who cannot afford to buy.
